intro: Humbertioturraea, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, broad ovate leaves, and showy yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in hot, dry climates and is adapted to poor soils. Humbertioturraea is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
